intro: Cheirolophus junonianus, commonly known as the Junonian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
